scenario:
The S&P 500 Index gained 24% in 2024, with Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A and BRK.B) performing similarly. Over the last two years, the broader market is up 53%, while Berkshire Hathaway has trailed the market but still performed well. The author believes this trend will reverse in 2025, with Berkshire Hathaway outperforming the S&P 500.

Berkshire Hathaway's equities portfolio is better positioned due to its reduced exposure to Apple, which now makes up only 25% of its portfolio, down from 30-40% mid-year. The company has also trimmed its stake in Bank of America and American Express, and holds a balanced portfolio with stocks in various sectors.

Berkshire Hathaway has a massive cash hoard exceeding $300 billion, providing a cushion, and has only repurchased a few billion dollars' worth of its own stock this year. The company is well-positioned to hedge inflation with its energy assets and stocks, including Berkshire Energy, Chevron, and Occidental Petroleum.

The S&P 500 may continue to move higher in 2025, but the market looks pricey and overly concentrated in the Fateful Eight stocks. Berkshire Hathaway's diversified portfolio, value names, and cash position make it well-positioned to outperform the broader market in 2025.
